Adam Ross

Web Developer | Programmer

Professional Profile

After graduating college I began my career by working in the energy sector. I became an engineer working all over North America for various energy companies. After a few years of doing this I was put on a project that involved some light programming work. I really enjoyed it. From there, I started teaching myself to program in my spare time. In 2015 I decided to take some time off work and attend a coding bootcamp to further my understanding. I enjoyed it, met some good people, and learned some useful skills. From there I learned Ruby on Rails, and started learning Javascript and front end tech. I'm several years in now, have a passion for development, and am looking to make it a full time job.

Employment History

Senior Engineer

Halliburton

  • - Oversaw and consulted on data aquizition and anaylysis for most of the Permian basin.
  • - Traveled to DFW and attened 2 months of training on Caliper and Bond logging fiber-obtic tool consultation.

Senior Engineer

GR Energy

  • - Oversaw and managed pump down and perforation operations for South and West Texas districs.
  • - Recieved training and consulted on the use of H1, EB, and Dyna explosive chain perforation systems.

Field Engineer

Torche Energy

  • - Consulted on and oversaw operations of GHOST fiber-optic tools.
  • - Managed and completed pump down and perforation operations using H1 and Dyna explosive chain system.

Career Highlights

- Breaking out as a senior engineer.

- Consulting h1 EC system.

- Working in North Dakota during the summers. Perfect weather.
